intro: Paropsiopsis jollyana, commonly known as the Jollyana's paropsiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
